citations.narrative:
Two litters of unweaned puppies do not have identification. Three Shi-Poo puppies were born 3/11/2025 and 3 Poodle
puppies were born 3/12/2025 but there is no identification assigned to the puppies. Identification is required in order to
ensure that each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate record keeping requirements for inventory,
disposition, transport, and healthcare documentation. The owner must identify all live regulated animals and assure that
records are kept at all times.

On the outside part of the older building there are 2 bottom door frame sections that are excessively rusted to the extent
that it is mostly deteriorated and no longer has any structural strength and cannot be cleaned and sanitized. The edges
are jagged and may be sharp enough to injure the dogs' feet. Interior surfaces and any surfaces that come in contact with
dogs must be free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization, or that affects the structural
strength of the surface; and be free of jagged edges or sharp points that might injure the animals.
Correction date: 1 May 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2)  Repeat
   
Time and method of identification. 
Two litters of unweaned puppies do not have identification. Three Shi-Poo puppies were born 3/11/2025 and 3 Poodle 
puppies were born 3/12/2025 but there is no identification assigned to the puppies. Identification is required in order to 
ensure that each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate record keeping requirements for inventory, 
disposition, transport, and healthcare documentation. The owner must identify all live regulated animals and assure that 
records are kept at all times. 
3.1(c)(1) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
On the outside part of the older building there are 2 bottom door frame sections that are excessively rusted to the extent 
that it is mostly deteriorated and no longer has any structural strength and cannot be cleaned and sanitized. The edges 
are jagged and may be sharp enough to injure the dogs' feet. Interior surfaces and any surfaces that come in contact with 
dogs must be free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization, or that affects the structural 
strength of the surface; and be free of jagged edges or sharp points that might injure the animals. 
 
Correction date: 1 May 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
